title: Has anyone read the book by Bessel Van Der Kolk called The Body Keeps the Score? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, I have…I’m not a psychologist, and I read the book for personal reasons, and is the most amazing book about “developmental trauma disorder” is like a bible of traumas details and explanations, great work and research by Bessel Van Der Kolk, MD. I had an amazing relationship with an amazing human being, somehow from the beginning I noticed that this girl was different, she had a tender soul, a childish innocence…, like if she had a frozen child inside herself, and I felt that she was a child living inside a grown up woman’s body and that’s exactly of what the books explains in detail, abused victims get frozen or stuck emotionally, they don’t grow or don’t develop themselves to update themselves to their present chronological age, but also shows you how to help these victims… It’s an amazing book, that everybody should read , to be aware of how mistreatment of infants can do and can affect them later in their adult lives. Good luck, I’m sure you’ll find a lot of answers…!!!

I am currently reading it slowly. I have only read about half, out of order so far. I find that unlike a novel the information is dense and requires processing. I am reading it at the suggestion of my therapist and find it to be a good companion to our sessions.
